edu.ucla.sspace.vector
Class CompactSparseIntegerVector

java.lang.Object
  edu.ucla.sspace.vector.CompactSparseIntegerVector
All Implemented Interfaces:
IntegerVector, SparseIntegerVector, SparseVector<Integer>, Vector<Integer>, Serializable, Iterable<IntegerEntry>
public class CompactSparseIntegerVector
extends Object
implements SparseIntegerVector, Serializable, Iterable<IntegerEntry>

A sparse IntegerVector class whose data is back by a compact sparse array. Access to the elements of this vector is O(log(n)).

Author:
Keith Stevens, David Jurgens
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

CompactSparseIntegerVector

public CompactSparseIntegerVector(int length)
Creates a new vector of the specified length

Parameters:
length - the length of this vector

CompactSparseIntegerVector

public CompactSparseIntegerVector(IntegerVector v)
Creates a new vector using the values of the specified vector. The created vector contains no references to the provided vector, so changes to either will not be reflected in the other.

Parameters:
v - the intial values for this vector to have

CompactSparseIntegerVector

public CompactSparseIntegerVector(int[] values)
Creates a new vector using the non-zero values of the specified array. The created vector contains no references to the provided array, so changes to either will not be reflected in the other.

Parameters:
values - the intial values for this vector to have

add

public int add(int index,

Changes the value in the vector by a specified amount (optional operation). If there is not a value set at index, delta should be set to the actual value.

toArray

public int[] toArray()
Returns an int array representing this vector. The returned array will be "safe" in that no changes to the array will be reflected in the vector, and likewise for changes to to the vector. The caller is thus free to modify the returned array.

Specified by:
toArray in interface IntegerVector
Returns:
an int array of this vector.
